summary: Replaces the intro and your character background as a prisoner with various alternative histories (bandit, necromancer, knight of the Silver Hand).
descriptionHtml:
In order to change the way Skyrim starts, you first have to edit the Skyrim.ini file, which can be found in your C:\\Users\\YOUR_USER_NAME\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim folder.


1)
Open your Skyrim.ini file and add one of the following line under the [General] tab:

For a bandit character add:
SStartingCell=WhiteRiverWatch01
  or
SStartingCell=LostKnifeHideout01

For a necromancer character add:
SStartingCell=FellglowKeep02

For a knight of the Silver Hand add:
SStartingCell=GallowsRock01

2)
Now copy the included batch files from this download into your Skyrim folder (where the TESV.exe is located).

3)
Start your game. Instead of the menu, the game will start directly in the location that you specified in the .ini-file.

4)
Open the console with the tilde-key (the key above tab).

5)
Type one of the following codes in the console (you might have to hit backspace once, otherwise the first entered key is missing):

For a bandit character type:
bat bandit

For a necromancer character type:
bat necromancer

For a knight of the Silver Hand type:
bat silverhand

6)
Hit the tilde-key again to close the console and create your character!
author: Lars Franke
